body:
> the lastpass chrome plugin exposes a problem with oc_template's default csp. if 'unsafe-eval' is allowed, there is no reason 'unsafe-inline' should not be allowed as well.

this is just not true, `unsafe-eval` allows the usage of eval in scripts while `unsafe-inline` forbids the execution of inline scripts. - this is there to mitigate potential xss attacks.

(the chance of a xss with a misused eval is much smaller and a thirdparty library needed it, but we will most likely also disallow the usage of `eval` in the foreesable futue)

> there have been other reports of this (#2307, #2479) blaming lastpass, when in actuality it is oc_template setting too strict csp.

so you're blaming us using a "strict csp", while it is only a shitty developed thirdparty plugin that causes problems?
